page.title: 04SCHOOL SUMMER FETE
page.content: On Saturday 22nd. June 1985, Lowerhouse Junior School held its annual summer fete, run by the Parent Teacher Association. The morning preparations were made in the rain, but the weather became much brighter for the fete, It opened at 2 p.m. with a performance by the Girls' Brigade Band. There were 8 stalls in the school hall. These included, a plant stall, a book stall, a handicraft stall, a home-made cake stall, a tombola, a raffle ticket stand, a toy stall and a white elephant stall. Our parents were helping on stalls. Outside were a pony ride, lots of games, including golf, for money prizes and photographs taken at the wheel of a double-decker bus. We raised quite a lot of money and hope to buy some new things for the pupils. Written by Claire Gorton.
